introduction: OH&S management software to different industries
title: About Us - SCRIM Safety First
description: About SCRIM Safety First. The SCRIM Safety First (SCRIM) Work Health and Safety (WHS) risk management software is owned by Accelrelation Pty.
header_text: How do I subscribe to SCRIM 365?
What training is provided with SCRIM 365?
What support services are provided with SCRIM 365?
How long does it take to get my subscription up and running?
What information can be integrated into SCRIM 365?
Where are the SCRIM system and databases hosted?
Which mobile devices does SCRIM support?
paragraph_text: SCRIM has more than 40 OHSAS 18001 and AS/NZS 4801:2012, ISO 18001, ISO 9001 and ISO 45001 Compliant Health and Safety Software Modules and over 160 customisable Dashboards, Charts and Reports.

SCRIM Safety First is a Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE Work Health and Safety solution available in the Microsoft Dynamics 365 public cloud. SCRIM seamlessly integrates with other Microsoft Dynamics 365 solutions such as Finance and Operations (previously AX), Field Service, Customer Service, Power BI, Power Apps as well as Office 365. Organisations license and users access SCRIM under the their company's existing Microsoft Office 365 subscription making it straightforward to purchase and giving you the guarantee of 24/7 global support in your own region and language.

SCRIM's state of the art Health & Safety application lets you report on critical Health & Safety data from anywhere your work takes you.

SCRIM's (progressive) web applications are fast and reliable as they work on any device both in Online and Offline mode.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Fatigue Management module is fully integrated with the Incident and Incident Investigations modules. It records and reports on incident trends by shift and roster to be used in roster and shift scheduling. The service (rostering) scheduling module is a separate module that leverages of the information collected by the Fatigue Management Module.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Drug and Alcohol Testing module allows for recording and tracking the results of random and post incident testing for the presence of alcohol and illicit drugs during the time of employment. Test results are only visible to those with authorised access.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Corrective Actions Module integrates with various other modules for the creation, assignment, tracking and where required automatic escalation of Corrective and Preventative Actions. Corrective Actions can be completed through the Worker Portal or the SCRIM Mobile Application.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Incident Management module provides Workers with instant access to report an Incident through the Worker Portal or SCRIM Mobile Application. Native applications are available for the latest Android, iOS or Windows 8 based smartphones and tablets. The module follows a process of Incident Reporting and Notification, Incident Investigation (Root Cause Analysis), Assignment of Corrective Actions and Incident Review and Sign-off. The systems sends automated emails and reminders to individuals and teams between each step of the process.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Hazard Management module records and tracks Incidental and Systematic identified workplace hazards. The Hazard module seamlessly integrates with the Risk Register, the Risk Control Measures module and Corrective Actions module. Hazards and Risk Control Measures can be recorded against high risk Operational Activities for automatic inclusion in Safe Work Method Statements and procedures. Workers can report on Hazards through the Worker Portal.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Injury Frequency Rate module provides trending insight for Lost Time Injury, Medically Treated Injury and Disability Frequency Rate reporting. It provides business unit and site level hours recording which can be retrieved from internal or external data sources. All reports and dashboards are configurable.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The inspections module allows the creation of templates for Workplace Inspections, pre start checklists and site audits. Inspections can be created, modified, and re-used for various types of Audits. Inspections can be completed online through the Worker reporting Portal or offline through our native application for Android, IOS or Windows phone, smartphones and tablets.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our
The Hazardous Chemicals and Dangerous Goods modules keep track of:
1.DG Class and GHS Classifications of chemicals.
2.Safety Data Sheets incl. revisions through automated notifications.
4.How the Chemical is stored and in which location.

5.Risk Assessments of the chemical. The Hazardous Chemicals module integrates seamlessly with the Risk Management and Risk Assessments modules. The Hazardous Chemicals module either links to or stores Safety Data Sheets and automatically notifies when an SDS is due for review. The Hazardous Chemicals module is compliant with the Global Harmonised System (GHS) of Classification and Labelling of chemicals.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Incident Investigations module allows for manual or automatic assignment and tracking of Incident Investigations to identify the Incident Root Cause and Contributing Factors. The module integrates seamlessly with the Incident Management and Corrective Actions modules in order for investigation findings and recommendations to be tracked through review, sign-off and close out.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Health Assessment Module records the results from health assessments such as audio metric, chest X-Ray and psychometric tests. It notifies users when tests are due and can assign users with actions to be taken.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Consultation Module keeps track of Workplace Health and Safety committee meetings, toolbox talks etc. Actions from consultations are created and tracked as Corrective Actions from within the module.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our
The Claims Management module allows for recording and tracking of insurance claims for a Return to Work managed injury. Users can export, import and email claim details from within the module.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Audit Management module allows the creation of Audits such as Site Audits and Legislative Compliance Audits. Templates can easily be created, modified and re-used for various purposes of Audits including (site) inductions.

Audits can be completed online through the Worker Reporting Portal using a web browser from a tablet or smartphone or offline through our native application for Android, iOS or Windows phone smartphones and tablets.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

risk management software is owned by Accelrelation Pty. Ltd. a privately held company with its head office in Sydney, Australia.
finds its origins in the Maritime Services industry and nowadays fits the needs of various industries.
SCRIM is an acronym derived from its core functions Safety Claim Risk and Injury Management.
The SCRIM WHS/OHS software is compliant with the following standards:
All our software development is performed in-house by our Microsoft Certified staff. We do not outsource or offshore any of our development or support work.
To reduce the number and severity of incidents and recordable workplace injuries by providing a
world class Easy To Use health and safety risk management system.
For organisations to put Safety First as safe organisations carry less operational risk and are as such, more sustainable and effective in creating long term shareholder value.
Are you looking for an international career in a rapidly growing organisation? Apply

SCRIM Health and Safety Software is committed to protecting your privacy and developing technology that gives you the most powerful and safe online experience. This Statement of Privacy applies to the SCRIM Health and Safety Software Web site and governs data collection and usage. By using the SCRIM Health and Safety Software website, you consent to the data practices described in this statement.

SCRIM Health and Safety Software collects personally identifiable information, such as your e-mail address, name, home or work address or telephone number. SCRIM Health and Safety Software also collects anonymous demographic information, which is not unique to you, such as your ZIP code, age, gender, preferences, interests and favorites.

There is also information about your computer hardware and software that is automatically collected by SCRIM Health and Safety Software. This information can include: your IP address, browser type, domain names, access times and referring Web site addresses. This information is used by SCRIM Health and Safety Software for the operation of the service, to maintain quality of the service, and to provide general statistics regarding use of the SCRIM Health and Safety Software Web site.

Please keep in mind that if you directly disclose personally identifiable information or personally sensitive data through SCRIM Health and Safety Software public message boards, this information may be collected and used by others. Note: SCRIM Health and Safety Software does not read any of your private online communications.

SCRIM Health and Safety Software encourages you to review the privacy statements of Web sites you choose to link to from SCRIM Health and Safety Software so that you can understand how those Web sites collect, use and share your information. SCRIM Health and Safety Software is not responsible for the privacy statements or other content on Web sites outside of the SCRIM Health and Safety Software and SCRIM Health and Safety Software family of Web sites.

SCRIM Health and Safety Software collects and uses your personal information to operate the SCRIM Health and Safety Software Web site and deliver the services you have requested. SCRIM Health and Safety Software also uses your personally identifiable information to inform you of other products or services available from SCRIM Health and Safety Software and its affiliates. SCRIM Health and Safety Software may also contact you via surveys to conduct research about your opinion of current services or of potential new services that may be offered.

SCRIM Health and Safety Software does not sell, rent or lease its customer lists to third parties. SCRIM Health and Safety Software may, from time to time, contact you on behalf of external business partners about a particular offering that may be of interest to you. In those cases, your unique personally identifiable information (e-mail, name, address, telephone number) is not transferred to the third party. In addition, SCRIM Health and Safety Software may share data with trusted partners to help us perform statistical analysis, send you email or postal mail, provide customer support, or arrange for deliveries. All such third parties are prohibited from using your personal information except to provide these services to SCRIM Health and Safety Software, and they are required to maintain the confidentiality of your information.
SCRIM Health and Safety Software does not use or disclose sensitive personal information, such as race, religion, or political affiliations, without your explicit consent.

SCRIM Health and Safety Software keeps track of the Web sites and pages our customers visit within SCRIM Health and Safety Software, in order to determine what SCRIM Health and Safety Software services are the most popular. This data is used to deliver customized content and advertising within SCRIM Health and Safety Software to customers whose behavior indicates that they are interested in a particular subject area.

SCRIM Health and Safety Software Web sites will disclose your personal information, without notice, only if required to do so by law or in the good faith belief that such action is necessary to: (a) conform to the edicts of the law or comply with legal process served on SCRIM Health and Safety Software or the site; (b) protect and defend the rights or property of SCRIM Health and Safety Software; and, (c) act under exigent circumstances to protect the personal safety of users of SCRIM Health and Safety Software, or the public.

The SCRIM Health and Safety Software Web site use "cookies" to help you personalize your online experience. A cookie is a text file that is placed on your hard disk by a Web page server. Cookies cannot be used to run programs or deliver viruses to your computer. Cookies are uniquely assigned to you, and can only be read by a web server in the domain that issued the cookie to you.

One of the primary purposes of cookies is to provide a convenience feature to save you time. The purpose of a cookie is to tell the Web server that you have returned to a specific page. For example, if you personalize SCRIM Health and Safety Software pages, or register with SCRIM Health and Safety Software site or services, a cookie helps SCRIM Health and Safety Software to recall your specific information on subsequent visits. This simplifies the process of recording your personal information, such as billing addresses, shipping addresses, and so on. When you return to the same SCRIM Health and Safety Software Web site, the information you previously provided can be retrieved, so you can easily use the SCRIM Health and Safety Software features that you customized.

You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. Most Web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline cookies if you prefer. If you choose to decline cookies, you may not be able to fully experience the interactive features of the SCRIM Health and Safety Software services or Web sites you visit.

SCRIM Health and Safety Software secures your personal information from unauthorized access, use or disclosure. SCRIM Health and Safety Software secures the personally identifiable information you provide on computer servers in a controlled, secure environment, protected from unauthorized access, use or disclosure. When personal information (such as a credit card number) is transmitted to other Web sites, it is protected through the use of encryption, such as the Secure Socket Layer (SSL) protocol.

SCRIM Health and Safety Software will occasionally update this Statement of Privacy to reflect company and customer feedback. SCRIM Health and Safety Software encourages you to periodically review this Statement to be informed of how SCRIM Health and Safety Software is protecting your information.

SCRIM Health and Safety Software welcomes your comments regarding this Statement of Privacy. If you believe that SCRIM Health and Safety Software has not adhered to this Statement, please contact SCRIM Health and Safety Software at
. We will use commercially reasonable efforts to promptly determine and remedy the problem.

What can I expect working for SCRIM?
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our
The most cost effective way to start with SCRIM 365 is to register for the 30 day free trial on this website.
In this way your first 30 days are free of charge and you will have 30 days to familiarise yourself with the system before committing to SCRIM 365.
We provide Business Administrator and End User training as part of the system setup and configuration.
Training is provided through web conference or if preferred, face to face at an additional cost.
Online user guides and training videos are accessible from within the system.
In addition, Microsoft provides a very large number of training resources on non Health & Safety specific functionality such as reporting, business process design and navigation please see:
SCRIM and its platform Microsoft Dynamics are globally supported 24/7 by our and Microsoft's global support teams.
SCRIM includes an inbuilt Support Module for automated support requests to the SCRIM Support teams.
The system also automatically notifies your a client's SCRIM Business Administrator of any user login and setup or configuration issues.

In the event the above does not work for you, we also provide a support hotline at no additional cost where you can speak with one of our support staff. We have Dutch, English, French, German, Hindi, Polish, Portuguese and Spanish speaking staff.
After completing the 30 day trial registration form, the system is up and running within 48 hours.
Anything that can be saved to a CSV file can be uploaded into SCRIM 365 using the Import Wizard.

Clients have a choice to host the SCRIM system and databases On Premise at our clients' data center of choice OR as part of SCRIM 365 with Microsoft Azure within the client's region and country of choice. For a selection of regions and countries see:

SCRIM's licensing model is based on that of Microsoft Dynamics and as such part of Microsoft's licensing programs. Clients can license the system on a monthly subscription basis or purchase the license straight out as part of a client's Microsoft (Select) Enterprise Agreement.

The SCRIM Portal is device response meaning that when connecting to the SCRIM Portal to report an Incident or Hazard or when completing an Inspection, the page will load and display based on the device's screen size. This ensures anybody with an internet or data connection is able to report through the SCRIM system without a need for installing software or an application. SCRIM also offers leading edge applications with offline data access capabilities for Android, iPhone and Windows smartphones and tablets. These prove to be particularly useful for situations where internet and data access are not always available.

As per our terms and conditions, our clients are the sole legal owner of the data stored in the SCRIM databases. If and when a client decides to end their SCRIM subscription we will provide the databases to our client. The SCRIM system includes (wizard) tools to easily extract any data to Excel or CSV files. Where required we provide a service for data extraction.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The manufacturing industry is considered one of Australia’s largest, employing over 980 000 workers making up 9% of Australia’s entire workforce.
Over 93% of its workers are covered for workers compensation. The most common issues experienced in this industry include:

The health and aged care industry covers workers in hospitals, medical, pathology and allied health services, aged and other residential care. 94% of workers in this industry are covered for workers compensation. Between 2009 and 2010 14% of all serious injury claims were made by workers in this industry. In real terms this equates to 48 employees each day requiring one or more weeks off work due to a work related injury.
The most common forms of issues experienced in this industry includes :

Forestry continues to be one of the most hazardous industrial sectors in most countries. Around the world, there are often discouraging trends of rising accident rates and a high incidence of occupational diseases and of early retirement among forestry workers. However, clear evidence shows that good safety and health performance in forestry is feasible.
The agriculture, Forestry and Fishing industry employ together around 315.000 workers which represents 2.6% of the national workforce. The most common issues experienced in this industry include:

The entertainment sector in Australia employs around 230.000 workers representing 1.9% of the total national workforce. The Australian Entertainment Industry Association is serious about health, safety and environmental issues.

Good management and risk planning will reduce incidents in the workplace ensuring the health and safety of persons at work is a shared responsibility between the producing company, the venue and their workers and contractors.
Some of the most common issues in this industry includes:

The education industry is considered our forth largest and crucial to the capacity of the rest of our workforce. The education industry is made up of primary and secondary teachers, university lecturers, education aides, vocation trainers, school principals, school commercial cleaners, sport coaches and instructors.  It provides jobs for about 828,000 workers or 8% of Australia’s total workforce.
Some of the most common issues in this industry includes:

The transport and logistics industry covers workers from a vast range of occupations including truck, bus, fork lift drivers, couriers and postal deliverers, warehouse workers, and others. The industry is responsible for the employment of approximately 579,500 workers equating to around 5% of the total Australian workforce.
Workers in this industry experience a higher rate of serious injury when compared to the national average. The most common issues experienced in this industry include:
Over the last decade there has been a significant decrease in the number of injuries due to improvements in the awareness of good Occupational Health and Safety practices.

Our customer testimonials will provide you with genuine, unbiased information about SCRIM Safety First's dedication to helping clients continuously improve their Workplace Health and Safety.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

SCRIM Users are associated with teams or groups at their work site. Within the Team Management Module users are set up to receive email notifications for events such as an Incident or Hazard being reported. Teams can be set up on a Organisation, Division/Business Unit or Work Site level with automatic escalations depending on severity.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our
The Work Site Management Module manages all SCRIM modules and reporting on a Work Site level from reporting events to Teams to managing risks. It contains three sub modules namely:
Work Sites and Locations are referred to in various modules of the SCRIM solution.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

Worker Management covers the management of individuals and entities classified as a worker under the AS/NZS 4801:2012 such as; (sub) contractors, employees, suppliers/vendors, site visitors etc.. Workers can report on Incidents, Hazards, Corrective Actions, Inspections and Risk Assessments through the SCRIM Worker Reporting Portal. The module keeps track of contact details, insurances, training/qualifications, injury history and automatically notifies Workers and their management where required.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Safe Work Method Statements or SWMS Module allows one to track SWMS against specific Job Roles, Operational Activities, such as Working at Heights, as well as specific Workers. The Module integrates with the Hazard Management, Risk Control Measures and Operational Activities Modules for the automatic generation of SWMS from identified Hazards through Job Safety Assessments (JSA).
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Safe Act or Safety Observations (SAO) Module records Worker compliance with Safe Work Method Statements and Procedures. Templates are created through the Checklist Module and can be scheduled and assigned to individual Workers or Teams. The actions from non-compliance are easily recorded and tracked as Corrective Actions from within the SAO Module.

The Skills Matrix tracks qualifications of workers and competencies required for the job roles that they have been assigned. It notifies users, and where required workers and their management, of qualifications coming up for renewal as well as certification and exam rebook dates etc. The module is fully configurable and comes with easy to customise charts, reports and dashboards.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Risk Control Measures Module allows for assigning risk controls to Incidental and Systematically identified Hazards. The module integrates with the module for Safe Work Method Statements for the automatic generation of Safe Work procedures.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Risk Control Measures Module allows for assigning risk controls to Incidental and Systematically identified Hazards. The module integrates with the module for Safe Work Method Statements for the automatic generation of Safe Work procedures.

The Risk Assessment module allows the creation of templates for Job Safety Assessments, SLAM and Critical Risk Standards. Risk Assessments can be created and assigned to users or teams as well as automatically periodically scheduled. Risk Assessment templates can be created, modified and re-used for various types of assessments. Risk assessments can be completed online through the Worker Reporting Portal or offline through our native application for Android, IOS, Windows phone, smartphones and tablets.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Return To Work module is at the core of our Suite of Health Modules. The module tracks both statistical and non-statistical RTW injuries such as LTIs and MTIs for workers. The module integrates seamlessly with the Medical Certificates, Rehabilitation and Claims Management modules. Return To Work Plans can be automatically generated from within the module. Meetings recorded in Outlook as well as emails and tasks can be (automatically) tracked against RTW records. The RTW module comes with easy to customise chart and dashboards as well as a report builder and export wizard supporting Word, Excel and Pdf export and mail merge.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Rehabilitation module is an integral part of our Return To Work module. As such it is part of any Return To Work plan. Details such as ”Rehabilitation Provider”, “Rehab Manager” and “Closure Outcome” can be recorded in this module.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our
The Psychometric Testing Module keeps track of Worker's health and safety risk awareness and can be used in assessing a Worker's suitability for performing certain tasks.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) Module allows you to track PPE by Site and Location and to report on its condition by item or group of items. It links in with the SWMS Module where PPE is mandatory for performing specific Operational Activities such as Working at Heights or Job Roles.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

Operational activities are the core activities undertaken by an organisation. It is used for analysing trends in the activity undertaken at the time of an incident and for the automated creation of Safe Work Method Statements or Safe Work Procedures aimed at reducing risk in high risk activities such as 'Working At Heights’.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Mobile Plant and Equipment Module tracks plant and equipment. It is more than just a register as it allows for service details, risk assessments, operating procedures and certification records to be recorded and tracked. The module automatically sends notifications when equipment or plant certification comes up for renewal. Items can have an asset number and associate the tag stored against each record.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

Upload and track certificates against workers and their Return To Work plans. The module tracks hours and days off work, suitable and alternative duties, and automatically sends notifications to a worker's manager and the return to work team or coordinator when a worker is expected to return to work or to provide a new certificate.
Copyright Protected by AccelRelation Pty Ltd  Read our

The Involved Persons Module records (injury) details of those involved in an incident, as a worker or witness. The module is an integral part of the Incident Management Module and records injury details of injured workers and if relevant, Drug and Alcohol test results. The module integrates with the Return To Work module for tracking statistical injuries. Like all other modules it comes with easy to configure charts, dashboards and reports.
